titlestmt.subtitle: A Guide to the holdings at the Black Film Center/Archive
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Mary Huelsbeck/Hannah Caproon/Gabriel Gardner

note.p: © 2011 Trustees of Indiana University. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-07-02 04:01:13 -0400.

did.abstract: Flyers, publications, and miscellaneous material related to the FESPACO Festival beginning in 2007.
did.langmaterial: Materials are in English and French

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: FESPACO, the Panafrican Film and Television Festival of Ouagadougou, was founded in 1969 and has become the largest African film festival. The festival takes place biennially and is held in Ouagadougou, the capital of Burkina Faso. FESPACO is known for culturally consolidating African film; directors and producers are welcomed from all over Africa and the Diaspora. Films and television programs are submitted for jury consideration in the categories of: Feature Films, Short Films, Documentaries, Television programs, & Series/Sitcoms.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into the following seven series:

list.item: Series 3. IMAGINE Film Training Institute materials
Series 6. Non-FESPACO small format promotional materials

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Items in the BFC/A's collection date back to the 2007 FESPACO festival. The majority of the collection consists of flyers intended to advertise films or film screenings and bound publications issued by official FESPACO publishers or publications topically related to FESPACO published by third-parties. Official publications include the Catalogue Officiel, which lists all the competing entries and their show times, and FESPACO News which is published daily during the FESPACO festival in French and English. Other publications in the collection are written in French. Also included are promotional flyers from African film production companies and advertisements for other film festivals taking place in Africa and Europe.

Items produced by IMAGINE (a film training institute founded by Gaston J. M. Kabore and located in Ouagadougou) are also included in the FESPACO collection. IMAGINE publications include informational pamphlets about the institute and a CD-ROM containing three promotional news clips about FESPACO.
A limited number of audiovisual items, including DVDs, are also collected by Martin during the festivals and are accessioned as part of the BFC/A's general film collections.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Date of acquisition: Acquired by Michael T. Martin on location at the 2007 through 2017 FESPACO Festivals.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Photocopying permitted only with permission of the Archivist.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [item], FESPACO Collection. 2007-2017. Black Film Center/Archive. Special Collection FE. Indiana University—Bloomington.

did.physdesc: 84 pages + 1 data disk (CD-R / COL 13 DD 1), milestone leaflet, FEPACI branded document folder

scopecontent.head: Content of data disk
scopecontent.p: FEPACI bylaws (PDF, in English), Feb. 2007 -- FEPACI by laws (PDF, in French), Feb. 2007 -- FEPACI ethics (PDF, in English), 2007 -- FEPACI ethics (PDF, in French), 2007 -- FEPACI rules of governence (PDF, English) -- FEPACI rules of governence (PDF, French) -- International Relations - IR Manager (powerpoint) -- Master Report, PH Final, Secretary General (Powerpoint), 2009 -- Media and Communications Report, Communications Manager (Powerpoint) -- Protocol Agreement (PDF, in English), 2008 -- Research and Education - Research Mana (Powerpoint), 2009 -- operational and readme files.
